question.text: A drop of mercury of radius <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>2</mn><mo> </mo><mi>mm</mi></math> is split into <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>8</mn></math> identical droplets. Find the increase in surface energy. (Surface tension of mercury is <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>0</mn><mo>.465 </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">J</mi><mo> </mo><msup><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></math> )

solution.text: Increase in surface energy or work done in splitting a big drop <math> <mrow> <mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>π</mi><msup> <mi>R</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mi>T</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msup> <mi>n</mi> <mrow> <mn>1</mn><mo>/</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow> </msup> <mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow> </math> <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mo>⇒</mo><mi>W</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>π</mi><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>)</mo></mrow><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>×</mo><mn>0.465</mn><mo>(</mo><msup><mn>8</mn><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>/</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>23</mn><mo>.</mo><mn>4</mn><mo> </mo><mi>μJ</mi></math>
